site_name: Part Of The South Acton Estate
description: Request for a Screening Opinion under regulation 5 of the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2011 (as amended) in respect of a minor material amendment application (under Section 73 of the T&CP Act) to vary conditions 3 (approved parameter plans), 18 (tree retention programme), 28 (Lifetime Homes), 31 (BREEAM), 36 (provision of Central Plaza in construction programme) and 42 (maximum quantum of non-residential floorspace) of planning permission P/2012/0708 dated 13/08/2013 for Outline planning application (reserving Appearance; Means of Access; Landscaping; Layout and Scale for later determination) for the continued regeneration of the South Acton Estate comprising of the demolition of buildings locations specified in the site address (including residential units, 521sqm of retail shops, 2,434sqm of community/ office facilities, hotel, garages and associated areas) and the erection of a maximum of 2,350 residential units, a maximum of 1,050sqm of flexible A1 (retail) / A3 (restaurant and cafe) / B1 (office) / D1 (community) uses, of which 600sqm is to be A1 (retail) use, a further 2,348sqm of D1 (community) / B1 (office) space (to include a minimum of 926sqm for provision of a community centre and youth club), energy centre, alterations to allotments, re-sited and enhanced open space and play facilities, landscaping, highway works and 1,128 car parking spaces (EIA Application) (and subsequently amended by non-material amendment applications LBE refs: P/2014/6303 approval dated 31/03/2015 and PP/2014/2142 approval dated 21/07/2014).
decision_conditions: The proposed development known as Phase 6 of the Acton Gardens LLP masterplan falls within 'Schedule 2 Development', as the development includes more than 150 dwellings and falls within the definition of an infrastructure project (10(b) Urban Development Projects).  The proposed development has been screened having regard to the selection criteria for screening schedule 2 development, as set out in the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2011 (as amended), namely having regard to:
(iii) the characteristics of the potential impact.

On this basis, the Local Planning Authority is of the opinion that the proposed development on its own and cumulatively with the development approved by outline planning permission ref: P/2012/0708 (dated 13/08/2013) would not be likely to have significant effects on the environment as interpreted by the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) (England) Regulations 2011 (as amended); and thereby does not constitute EIA development requiring an Environmental Statement.

This is not to say that the proposed development alone or cumulatively with the extant outline planning permission for the regeneration of the South Acton Estate would not result in environmental effects, and indeed such impacts were identified in the Environmental Statement submitted with the extant outline planning permission. However, it is considered that such impacts would be of a localised nature and could be appropriately mitigated.
